topic.title: Testing installation with telnet
topic.shortdesc: The simplest method to determine whether Couchbase Server is running is by using Telnet to connect to the server and using the Memcached text protocol.

body.p: Telnet must be installed on your server to connect to Couchbase Server using this method. Telnet is supplied as standard on most platforms, or may be available as a separate package that should be easily installable via your operating systems standard package manager.
body.note: You do not need to use the Telnet method for communicating with your server within your application. Instead, use one of the Couchbase SDKs.
body.codeblock: > telnet localhost1 Trying 127.0.0.1... Connected to localhost.localdomain (127.0.0.1). Escape character is '^]'.
body.p: Make sure itâ€™s responding (stats is a great way to check basic health):
body.codeblock: stats STAT delete_misses 0 STAT ep_io_num_write 0 STAT rejected_conns 0 ... STAT time 1286678223 ... STAT curr_items_tot 0 ... STAT threads 4 STAT pid 23871 ... END
get test_key VALUE test_key 0 1 a END
quit Connection closed by foreign host. >
body.p: All of the Memcached protocols commands will work through Telnet.
